basics.name: Alexander Mars
basics.summary: Founder with experience across data science, machine learning, molecular biology, research, strategy, and product development. Aiming to leverage artificial intelligence to create products that help society.

work.name: Swan Genomics
work.summary: Swan Genomics is developing a novel kind of single molecule DNA sequencing technology. My bachelor's thesis in 2019 initiated the project, with designs from my thesis still employed in the core technology. Currently, I am helping to bridge the gap between the software team and experimental biology team by developing production-ready data processing pipelines.
highlights: Spun out of UNSW Australia with backing from international VCs.
Developing optimised algorithms for image and sequence data processing.

work.name: Goto.Health
work.position: Advisor and acting Chief Data Officer (Part-Time)
work.summary: Goto.Health is a health tech startup guaranteeing real-time healthcare appointment availability price transparency for patients, whilst providing guaranteed payment for clinics. I advise across product, strategy, fundraising, and data science.

work.name: DogBase
work.summary: DogBase is a startup providing first-in-class software for training working dogs. I am building various models to improve dog training performance monitoring.
highlights: Built a state of the art breed prediction model over 100 breeds.
Developed a multi-class classification model to predict dog emotion.
Models productionised via Google Cloud Platform via a serverless approach.

work.name: Portal
work.summary: Portal was a startup leveraging AI agents to orchestrate brand strategy and create automated marketing campaigns. I led the integration of state-of-the-art AI research into Portal’s AI agent management platform. My role focused on creating conversational agents for domain-specific tasks through a combination of fine-tuning and retrieval augmented generation on large language models (LLMs).
highlights: Developed an approach for keeping a conversational AI agent (LLM) on rails during a conversation based on information theory. The method ensured that at every conversational turn the agent asked the most relevant question to the customer.
Took ownership over a whitelisted model training pipeline provided by Google, building custom evaluation pipelines for these models in Vertex AI using Kubeflow.
Introduced a product-centric approach to Portal’s software development process to reprioritise feature development based on user experience.

The final product Portal worked on was savely.com.au, an AI-powered approach to finding the cheapest energy provider in Australia tailored to your usage. Portal's CEO continued to bootstrap savely after Portal shut down.

work.name: RewiredBio
work.summary: RewiredBio was focused on discovering safer, more effective therapeutics by modelling drug targets as they appear in their natural cellular environment through a combination of AI and molecular biology.
highlights: Raised a pre-seed round in 2022 from one of Australia’s prominent venture capital firms.

Responsible for overall business and financial strategy, hiring, and leading a team of data scientists to develop proprietary software that leveraged deep graph learning, transfer learning, and natural language processing.
Engaged with senior stakeholders from large pharmaceutical companies such as Pfizer and Astrazeneca, and negotiated partnerships with biology equipment suppliers.
Lead work in machine learning that was deemed patentable by our IP lawyers, however we lacked the funds to proceed to a filing.

volunteer.summary: Monthly patrols down at Bondi Beach, keeping people out of harms way. On leave whilst overseas.

courses: Data structures and algorithms, database design, statistics, machine learning and data mining, visual analytics, computational statistics, advanced machine learning, natural language processing, and complex systems.
education.thesis: Characterising sparse neural networks in the context of noisy labels with the trustworthy machine learning group: https://www.tmllab.ai/.
The Development of a Novel Single Molecule DNA Sequencer, 2019. Spun out to form Swan Genomics in April 2023.

summary: Awarded a full scholarship, and the Ekard Research School of Biological Science and the Lorry I. Lokey Research School of Biochemical Science Excellence Prize.

Withdrew from the program as I placed too much importance on the courses and degree title...I felt that I wasn't going to learn enough in a computational biology masters that could open doors in the broader data science and AI industry, so I left to pursue a program at Sydney University focused on that.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
